intro: Rytidosperma fulvum, commonly known as the yellow panicgrass, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its tufted growth habit and dense, yellowish-green foliage. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear numerous tiny florets, typical of grasses. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and coastal dunes. Rytidosperma fulvum is adapted to withstand drought and is an important component of native vegetation in its native range.
